about.title: About Me
about.text: I might not actually be an astronaut... but I am a digital designer with a diverse skill set ranging from motion graphics to front-end web development. I'm a strong believer that if something is worth doing, it's worth doing right. At heart, I'm a maker. I love building things from the ground up, whether it's a woodcut or a brand identity.

skills.title: UX Skills
skills.tools: Figma, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects, Premiere, ProTools, Fiery Impose, HTML/CSS, JavaScript
skills.soft_skills: Workflow optimization, customer service, logistics, communication, management, computer networking
skills.design_skills: Visual design, user experience, wireframing, rapid prototyping, storyboarding, user research, interviewing, responsive web, interaction, motion, sound

education.description: Six-month training certificate in an online classroom setting.

education.institution: Savannah College of Art and Design
education.description: Developed branding solutions and production artwork for broadcast networks. Utilized Adobe Creative Suite, including Adobe After Effects and 3D Software. Gained experience with sound design and web development.

projects.title: Travel App
projects.description: In this student project, I went through the process of identifying a user need through to a high-resolution prototype, while incorporating user feedback throughout the process.

projects.title: Government Agency Redesign
projects.description: I analyzed the data structure of the Homeland Security website and integrated user feedback into its redesign. A new brand style guide was created and web and mobile prototypes were built with responsive web design in mind.

projects.title: Non-Profit Website Redesign
projects.description: I worked with a team to redesign an existing non-profit website while implementing mobile-first principles and a user-centered approach.

projects.title: Travel App
projects.overview: Objective: Create an app to solve a problem a user might encounter when traveling with a group.

sections.title: Research
sections.text: As a group of 5, we recorded interviews with general questions about traveling in a group.

sections.title: Definition
sections.text: Moving into the rest of the process, I broke off from my group with my own direction based on user feedback.

sections.title: Prototyping
sections.text: Lo-Fi / Mid-Fi Prototypes created and tested based on user feedback.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.text: Integrating user feedback during the research stage helped identify which parts of the process the app could actually improve.

projects.title: Government Agency Redesign
projects.overview: This individual student project was completed over the course of 4 weeks. The goal was to analyze and redesign a government agency website for improved usability and responsiveness.

sections.title: User Research
sections.text: I used traffic analysis of the website to establish the most common types of users and tasks. A proto-persona was created to better understand user needs.

sections.title: Testing
sections.text: Key pain points were identified, including difficulty in navigation and overwhelming menu structures.

sections.title: Wireframing
sections.text: Wireframes were created for the homepage using mobile-first and atomic design principles.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.text: Restructuring the site navigation and focusing on a clean design drastically improved usability.

projects.title: Non-Profit Website Redesign
projects.overview: A team of five was tasked with redesigning an existing non-profit website, focusing on mobile-first principles and user-centered design.

sections.title: Research
sections.text: Users found it difficult to navigate due to jumbled information and outdated navigation features.

sections.title: Definition
sections.text: We defined the problem statement and aimed to make the adoption process more intuitive and clear.

sections.title: Prototyping
sections.text: Interactive prototypes allowed us to evaluate the user experience more effectively.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.text: By streamlining the adoption process and prioritizing user needs, the redesign has the potential to increase engagement and donations.
